com.tranek.chivalryserverbrowser

Class GamepadSensitivityDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • com.tranek.chivalryserverbrowser.GamepadSensitivityDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GamepadSensitivityDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    The dialog for editing the gamepad's look sensitivity which is bound to the right thumbstick. There are two different values - one for looking left to right and one for up and down with default values of 1.0 and 0.65 respectively.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels any changes made in the dialog. Does not write anything to disk.

        public void setDefaults()
        Sets the sensitivity fields to their default values.

      • getBinding

        public java.lang.String getBinding(java.lang.String file,
                          java.lang.String button)
        Gets the sensitivity values from the configuration file. It looks for the configuration file in the user's "Documents\My Games\Chivalry Medieval Warefare\UDKGame\Config" directory.
        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file where the bindings are located
        button - the gamepad button to get the bindings for
        Returns:
        the commands bound to the button separated by " | "
        See Also:
        Keybinds, JFileChooser.getFileSystemView(), FileSystemView.getDefaultDirectory(), BufferedReader, FileReader

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed(java.lang.String file,
              java.lang.String button)
        Gets the speed value for a look command.
        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file where the bindings are located
        button - the look command name
        Returns:
        the speed value for this look command
        See Also:
        getBinding(String, String), Keybinds

      • writeSpeed

        public boolean writeSpeed(java.lang.String file,
                 java.lang.String button,
                 java.lang.String speed)
        Writes the new speed values back to the configuration file.
        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file where the bindings are located
        button - the look command name
        speed - the speed value to write to the configuration file
        Returns:
        true if it successfully wrote to the configuration file; false otherwise
        See Also:
        writeBinding(String, String, String), Keybinds

      • writeBinding

        public boolean writeBinding(java.lang.String file,
                   java.lang.String button,
                   java.lang.String commands)
        Writes a new binding for a button to the configuration file.
        Parameters:
        file - the configuration file where the bindings are located
        button - the gamepad button to write the bindings for
        commands - the commands to write for the gamepad button
        Returns:
        true if successfully written to the config file; false otherwise
        See Also:
        Keybinds, JFileChooser.getFileSystemView(), FileSystemView.getDefaultDirectory(), BufferedReader, FileReader, FileWriter, BufferedWriter
